description: A device registered with the switch
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD LINK-INCIDENT-MIB::linkRNIDDeviceRegistration LINK-INCIDENT-MIB::nodeRNIDIndex i 9999 LINK-INCIDENT-MIB::nodeRNIDIncidentPortWWN s EXAMPLEE LINK-INCIDENT-MIB::nodeRNIDConnectedPortWWN s EXAMPLEE LINK-INCIDENT-MIB::nodeVfId i 0 LINK-INCIDENT-MIB::ficonSlot i 9999 LINK-INCIDENT-MIB::ficonPort i 9999

description: Index into nodeRNIDTable
variables.name: LINK-INCIDENT-MIB::nodeRNIDIndex

description: Port WWN for Incident port. An N-port (ficon device
or host) is an incident port
variables.name: LINK-INCIDENT-MIB::nodeRNIDIncidentPortWWN

description: WWN of the connected port.
variables.name: LINK-INCIDENT-MIB::nodeRNIDConnectedPortWWN

description: The Virtual fabric id of the switch. For VF unaware switches
this value will be 0.
variables.name: LINK-INCIDENT-MIB::nodeVfId

description: It indicates the slot number in the switch.
variables.name: LINK-INCIDENT-MIB::ficonSlot

description: It indicates the port number in the switch.
variables.name: LINK-INCIDENT-MIB::ficonPort

description: A device de-regsitered with the switch

be 0 (zero) , if there is no listener for incident.
